alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Newton; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 1:28PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Jasper, southwestern Newton and eastern Smith Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 128 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Taylorsville, or 8 miles west of Stringer, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Center Ridge around 135 PM CDT. Bay Springs around 140 PM CDT. Turnerville and Pineville around 145 PM CDT. Roberts and Garlandville around 200 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Sylvarena, Montrose and Louin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for central, southeastern and east central Mississippi.
